author: plutode95
title: Outstanding care for kidney stones
body:
From the moment i was diagnosed with kidney stones in April I have received outstanding service from NHS, from my local doctor's surgery to East Surrey Hospital a&e.  
I had to attend a&e at 0100hrs in April as the pain I was in was intense. The wait time in a&e was only 20 mins, staff saw my suffering, I was in a hospital bed with no more pain within 40 mins, x-rayed, scanned and diagnosed by 0900 hours that same morning.  
Fantastic.  
These staff and doctor of urology at around 1300 hours inserted 1 x stent into each of my ureters where these stones were located, this was again a great relief as it allowed my body to function as it should.  
Urology doctor tells me their plan of action: to arrange a time with me to return to get these kidney stones out, they will examine the stones once removed in an attempt to find what food they are formed from, that way I can adjust my diet. I do not want a repeat of these kidney stones forming inside my body... no more pain!  
Thanks NHS.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Debbie48
title: Well organised for getting vaccine
body:
All the staff were amazing from the car park to getting checked in to getting my vaccine.  
Everything is so well organised and everyone makes you feel calm and relaxed. SSE Arena in Belfast is so well set up. There are no massive queues, parking is easy and free.  
I was nervous but I can’t wait to get my second jab there. I know I have played my small part in keeping me and others safe. Thank you to all the staff that are working hard to keep us safe.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: JKMK142
title: Lovely staff at Foyle arena vaccination
body:
Had my first vaccine for covid 19. I was in at 9:33 and out at 9:56!  
Big thanks to everyone involved. Lovely staff along the way and great team who administered the jab itself. Very informative and friendly and putting me at ease.  
I was asking questions about the jag with breastfeeding and great to get praise for still breastfeeding my 11 month old baby.  
Sorry I cant remember the 2 individual's names. Thank you to everyone!

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Failure of a service
body:
I have suffered with clinical depression for greater than three years. Over this period I have received essentially no support From Pepperville House. 

When I went through my most recent depressive episode I was suicidal and I informed Pepperville house of this. I was then again offered no further support and threatened with being discharged which only made my condition worse. 

My GP shares my frustration with the service and has tried endlessly to help me access support from Pepperville With no effect.

author: Adzsett7
title: Contraceptive implant
body: Went for the Contraceptive implant, it was few seconds feel nothing, Thanks

author: AMagee
title: Friendly, kind and professional nurse at covid vaccination
body:
Both my husband and I attended Covid vaccination centre in Ballymena, NHSCT today, it was a smooth operation from arrival.  
The nurse who gave me my vaccine in cubicle F, a gynae nurse was friendly, kind and professional. Many thanks for making this experience a good one.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Ukizzy
title: Shocked to be sent away by St Andrews minor injuries unit
body:
Shocked by my husband's treatment at St Andrews Community Hospital minor injuries unit today. He attended after injuring his knee and being almost unable to walk.  
He was told to go away and call 111 or contact a GP. His GP was 450 miles away.  
I feel bad writing anything negative about the NHS but this treatment was completely unexpected, particularly when the unit only had one other patient. In the end he had to call a helpful local GP, register as a temporary patient and we managed to get an appointment that day.  
What a contrast in attitude and care.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: LinB
title: Painful hysteroscopy without anaesthetic
body:
From the information I was sent prior to the hysteroscopy it sounded as if it was not going to be any more uncomfortable than a colposcopy. I had had post menopausal bleeding and a scan showing the endometrial lining was slightly thicker than it should be.  
I drove to the University Hospital of Wales in Cardiff on my own - this was late summer 2020 so because of Covid there was very little interaction before or during the procedure.  
The doctor and nurse were polite but nothing prepared me for the pain I felt. At no time did anyone discuss whether this could be done under a general anaesthetic or offer a general anaesthetic following the scan I had. I had had painful experiences including a fainting episode during IUD insertion and removal many years previously but no one asked me about this. Apparently if they had, or if I had mentioned the problems I experienced having a routine cervical smear then a general anaesthetic may have been considered. Although I acknowledge that I am a higher anaesthetic risk because of my high BMI.  
They started the procedure and it was obvious to them that I was in pain so the nurse handed me gas and air and explained how to use it. The pain was already quite bad with the scope inserted, and it felt as if there was air or water being pushed in, I don't know which but it became more and more painful.  
The doctor said they needed to take a biopsy, this was excruciatingly painful and the gas and air did not really do anything to alleviate the pain other than make me feel very lightheaded. They wanted to take a bigger biopsy as the doctor said they were not sure they had managed to get a big enough sample but had to stop because of the pain.  
I think they wanted me to say to carry on but there was no way I was going to voluntarily go through that pain again. I have had pylonephritis in the past and this was much worse.  
The results came back as clear about 3 weeks later, mentioning a polyp. So I believe the biopsy was enough to be able to test it. But I do know now that I could have been offered a general anaesthetic, and probably would have been if anyone had taken an adequate history.

readBy.name: Cardiff and Vale University Health Board
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Harp
title: Unhelpful advice on weight loss
body:
I've had a very underactive thyroid for 20 years, taking thyroid tablets every day. I suffer with arthritis and a knee that swells 3x times bigger with fluid, causing a lot of pain.  
I have tried to lose weight, always watching what I eat, and no change. I asked the nurse for some help with how to lose weight. Her exact words to me were: sit back from the table.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: April2021Baby
title: Lack of continuity with community midwives
body:
Over the first 10 days postpartum we saw 4 different midwives (unsure if this was due to COVID or some other reason).  
The midwife who visited us on day 3 was completely unhelpful - was only interested in completing the notes, overwhelmed us with information & then started talking about blind safety for when she started crawling! The same midwife came back to do a repeat heel prick test on day 8 & showed no compassion at all - squeezed so much blood out of my baby that she was howling. I started to cry & her comment was “bit emotional are we?”  
The other midwives were fantastic, answered all our questions & were so compassionate (especially the day 10 midwife).  
It would have been so much better if we’d have more continuity of care with our community midwife visits (& that my husband was allowed at the hospital & midwife appointments - he was only allowed at our two scans and was only allowed in for our emergency section almost at the end - having to do the whole thing alone was HORRIBLE).  
It’s ridiculous that during the time when you’re allowed to queue in Tesco with 100’s of people he was only allowed to stay with the baby & me for 2 hours post surgery & a 1 hour visiting slot in hospital (thankfully I was only in for 2 nights but if it had been any longer there would have been days he wouldn’t have seen our baby at all!).  
We have said this is our only baby & I feel sad there was so much of the “normal” pregnancy & birth experience he missed out on & that I had to go through alone.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Bonzo
title: Orthotics Service
body: I feel that 'Sue' has excellent customer relations, she is always very friendly and goes far beyond her duties to give an excellent and prompt customer service.

links.id: i require a raise on my right shoe

author: Arlene21
title: My biopsy
body: I was very nervous and anxious but was quickly put at easy with the   funny team at Forth Valley David, Lee-Ann and Rachel. Had a good laugh! Thank you.

author: swimgirl
title: The care was amazing
body:
I swim and hike each week and went swimming but the tide was further so while I waited I walked qnd took a small fall into hole in grass. I did RICE but got no better so headed AE Criagavon
The care was amazing qnd especially in minor injuries from Ursula. I had chipped bone and got bandages up and away with crutches. I had to return as my thumb was still sore and again Ursula and Gillian and physio Helen gave me such amazing care. The hospital was so clean, warm, welcoming, organised and efficient. Every staff member made me feel safe having not been in a hospital and avoiding people in lockdown I couldn’t think of a worse place to be in Covid world but the staff were incredible. I felt so cared for and the advice and support was outstanding even when busy they had time to go through things and double check before I left. They are a credit to your team and make life much easier when I had to visit Craigavon minor injuries on two occasions in two weeks after none in 40 years. Thank you all

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Braw Lass
title: Treated with kindness and respect
body: I had an appointment with the dermatology department at BGH and saw Dr Kemmett. I have to say that, although I waited over a year for the appointment due to COVID-19 and my skin was very much improved by then, Dr Kemmett was the nicest and most understanding doctor I have ever consulted. He treated me with kindness and respect and I just wished I had been able to see him earlier.

author: melonhb79
title: My father
body: My father is in hospital very unwell, and due to covid 19 no visitors were allowed in to the ward so via the virtual visiting service I was able to see him and speak with him to which I'm so thankful for

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Sunshine99
title: Wonderful staff
body: I was recently a patient within ward 7 in Monklands hospital and I can not thank the staff enough for the care I received! The nurses were extremely hard work and nothing was too much trouble! ! As a retired nurse to see the Ward Sister on the floor working with her staff and participating in patient care, is an amazing sight! Leading by example is the best way to run a team and I can say certainty as a service user that ward 7 is an efficiently run ward with patient care is at the centre of everything! Thank you! !

author: Holldoll
title: Implant change and kind nurse
body: I went to have my implant taken out and a new one put in. I was very nervous to start with but the nurse who dealt with me was very kind and reassuring and I actually had a very good experience. I also have Autism so the nurse took that into consideration and allowed my partner to be with me to help make the experience a lot better for me and she explained step by step as to what she was doing which made me feel a lot better.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: learningcx49
title: Contraceptive implant
body: It was quick and easy. the nurse definitely put my mind at ease as I was very anxious about it but came out very happy. professional and friendly staff very good service

author: Squeeky
title: So grateful to all the NHS staff
body: So I was diagnosed in early 2019 with renal stage 4 cancer, in March 2020 the treatment I was having had killed the cancer right back to my affected kidney that I had surgery to remove the tumour and kidney. At present I still have some lymph nodes on my lungs but they are stable. I am still working full time and so grateful to all the NHS staff, nurses, consultants surgeons just everyone who has made this all possible, you are all HEROES in both myself and my wife’s eyes so thank you so so much

author: Kedge75
title: Outpatient Hysteroscopy
body:
Firstly, I have had surgery for an intersusseption and rushed back in 3 days later with adhesions. I have had spine surgery for damage brought on from symphosis Pubis Disorder (a separated pelvis) during my 4th and 5th pregnancy, having no painkillers for 8 hours the next morning. All 5 boys were born naturally.  
I have had a flap torn in my cornea from my son's nail. I have polyarthralgia and fibromyalgia. I KNOW PAIN. I have lived with it all of my adult life.  
NOTHING I have encountered was as traumatising as the hysteroscopy I had in March this year. I was not given informed consent. I was told it would be like a period pain. I was thinking it might be about the same as getting a Mirena coil fitted. Boy, was I wrong!  
It was indescribable pain. I was having to breathe out panicked intakes of breath, like I was in Labour. I was squeezing onto the nurses hand for dear life. It was barbaric. That is the only way I can describe it.  
The fact that these procedures are carried out on women when it is expected that 1 in 4 will have an experience the same as mine should be a great source of shame for the gynaecology profession.  
The registrar who carried it out kept saying that they were testing my pain tolerance for the ablation that I should have had last year. Why? Why did they feel the need to do that? Also, I was offered a pain relief suppository AFTER the procedure. Why? Why not BEFORE?  
I went home, curled up on my bed, and sobbed myself to sleep. I am a 45-year-old woman with a very high pain tolerance. This made me unable to sleep for 2 nights because it was so traumatising and so hard to get my head around why not one of the 5 people in that room stopped it when they saw my very obvious distress.  
I feel that it has a base in misogyny, and not believing women when they say they are in pain.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: tigernb34
title: Hysteroscopy at york hospital
body: I was told that the pain would be like period pain it was not it was excruciating I had to polyps removed and biopsy with out any pain control at all I am 58 years old have only given birth by caesarean and am post menopausal 1 in 4 women suffer terrible pain with office hysteroscopy so why was I even subjected to this as its known that post menopausal women that have never given birth naturally or had children by caesarean make up a large proportion of these 1 in 4 I feel like a guinea pig. I will never let another doctor touch me again as I have zero trust and to me they are the bogey man.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Leilei
title: Two months trying to get appointment
body: Spent 2 months trying to get an appointment to see my usual gp as they knows more about my medical conditions and can't be going through it with different gp every time, usual response is no appointments available, heading Into month 3 of trying now and pain is unbearable and getting worse, wasn't this bad getting an appointment before they moved and I know covid covid covid but that's not helping me walk

readBy.name: Meadowgreen Health Centre & The Avenue Medical Practice

author: Kayleighy
title: Birth of our baby
body: I arrived at Peterhead just after 3 in the morning, was assessed and sent straight to the moonlight suite. The midwifes were super accommodating of both me and my partner and did everything they could to help.

author: Mars50
title: COVID vaccine help
body:
Having been unable find why my second vaccination letter had not arrived I spoke on the phone to Eric at NHSFife. Having had no help on an NHS online form I filled nor being untraceable on the 0800 line within a few minutes Eric found out why I’d been dropped from the system . He took my details and was able to arrange an appointment  
He was friendly , polite and a pleasure to deal with. Many thanks Eric.

author: Fife teacher
title: Stress free process
body: The whole process of getting the vaccinations in the Kirkcaldy centre was slick and so stress free.   I felt fully informed and everyone made sure I was at ease.   Apart from a sore arm and armpit I was non the worse for wear and I'm now fully vaccinated.   Well done on such a well. organised operation.

author: Sharon@1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Going above and beyond
body:
I was referred to Alison at the Primary Care Occupational Therapy team due to a Road traffic accident to help with my mobility initially and to help me become as mobile as I could.  
Alison has been brilliant and has really been going above and beyond for me and I have been getting the proper help that is needed for me.  
Alison has not only been helping me with the physical aspects that have been needed, she has been helping me mentally also, giving me a way to look at things from a different perspective.  
My treatment has been on going over the last few months and I am very satisfied with the service offered to me so far and would highly recommend Alison for Occupational Therapy to other people. All in all, Alison is a lovely person.

author: Klempy
title: My CBT Journey for Depression
body:
From the first session I had with Victor I felt listened to and each thought and feeling even things I couldnt find words for were being taken in, I felt comfortable sharing my experiences and thoughts and felt respected and that he did his best to help me and understand me.
Each session truely felt like it was tailored to me with specific points of concern being subject to a session or more with specific documents and worksheets that followed my concerns with particular thoughts or feelings. Everything I brought up was always listened to and taken seriously as we discussed how to move forward and such. I always felt like I was in charge and that it was for me and I had no issues whatsoever.
The sessions helped me discover more of how I truely felt and how to progress with that with some things being a larger impact on my depression than I first realised, and finding new ways to go about things.
The things I was given to do outside of the sessions were extremely helpful in gaining a better understanding of myself and more control over my depressive thoughts and behaviours. With the point of CBT being to use these learned skills and techniques to assist yourself in the future.
By the end I feel that I have a good understanding that I can help myself to further myself in this journey and that if I were to relapse I would have the means to help myself.
I was completely understood and the sessions were great, I had a great experience with Victor and so with the CBT I feel 100% happy with the experience and would fully recommend using this counselling as it has truely helped me.

title: Great Service
body: I went for my covid vaccination the process was very well organised, i did not have to wait very long. The staff is very helpful and careing. Overall the surgery provides a very good service. I would highly recommend this surgery.

title: Rude receptionist
body: Was chatting to the receptionist when I didnt get my pills got a bit heated and her answer to the conversation was to tell me well if you don't like it change doctors and put the phone down how rude does she treat all of her customers like that

title: Fantastic service
body: I have felt with my go quite a lot during lock down and to be honest I can’t praise them enough very professional and on the ball all staff have been amazing and feel I need to say this as we are all quick to complain but never quick to praise people of the good things

title: Outstanding
body:
Thank you for the great service, the amount of things we can do online is great and always improving, I can now do everything online except for booking an appointment, which I always used to do online.
Can you advise when this will be available again, or even through the website, where we can leave a message and be prompted to call for urgent problems, especially as we are no longer aware of how long we have to wait.

title: Awful
body:
Worst practice I have ever known as a patient.
Rude staff and virtually impossible to get an appointment.
I suggest going straight to A & E. 
This is the only option available when dealing with this surgery.
The staff here are not bothered about putting the local hospital under more pressure.

title: worst service - no online booking - strict 8am…
body: I been here as a patient but its not good service at all, there is a few people working very good but some people from reception who are unhelpful, when you call them they don't give you appointment if you call afterwards mid-day i think the worst part is with the people on reception some of them are very rude and unhelpful if you live in newmalden try another gp

title: Only interested in Covid
body: I'm desperately trying to get an appointment for my elderly father who needs a GP but not an emergency.  Really finding it impossible to do. All they seem to be interested in is COVID. 1 person died yesterday. I'm really worried about my father but all I get is a recorded message about COVID and despite phoning every 5 minutes after 8am  this message changed at 8.35 to all appointments gone. Been trying for days now. How do i get a doctor to speak to my 87 year old father?

title: Excellent care
body: I would just like to thank the A&E department staff for the excellent care my father received in CDU. My father was put on the End of Life Care Pathway and the staff delivered excellent care and kindness throughout. Many thanks, Garrie-John Barnes.

title: unable to contact on the phone
body: I have tried to call for several hours one morning. The line is always engaged or no answer. You need to interact with patients via email. If other practices can, then you can too. I hate to imagine those who are very sick, must be put through.

title: Caring practice
body: I had the coil fitted for the first time today. Both the doctor and healthcare facilitator were so kind and really put my mind at ease. I felt a little faint after the procedure but they were both incredible at looking after me and I honestly can't thank them enough for the level of care and kindness they showed me. Thank you.

author: Bubbles2021
title: A vital service
body:
Mum was admitted. Has severe dementia, gets 24hr care at home has never been in hospital (just to have babies) never in respite so must be very afraid.  
Ward staff unable to give an update other than mum was sleeping. This added to our anxiety. This let us see her and made us very content.  
Whilst mum was unable to talk to us we could see that her condition was similar to her baseline and this was of major importance to us and in particular my dad  
A vital service that as a family we are eternally grateful for having it.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: First Class
body: I liked that I wasn’t rushed through my appointment and that because there was a problem they had me back in a couple of days for a recall.

title: Mal Practice
body: Locum doctors, unprofessional receptionists and an inept practice manager. Complaints aren't handled in a timely fashion. Very disappointing to be forced to contribute via taxes to a practice that doesn't understand how to manage primary care efficiently.

title: Wonderful help and assistance
body: The afternoon staff at Western Avenue Surgery were of great help and assistance to my Mother. They were professional at all times and extremely kind and understanding. I cannot praise them enough for going out of their way to help my elderly Mother.

title: Really good practice but terrible appointments…
body:
I was on hold for over 30 minutes with a message saying that I was 1st in the queue to arrange an appointment, and that the delay was because of high call volumes.  If I was actually first in the queue call volumes are irrelevant and so either the messaging is incorrect or appointment calls are not answered for extended periods.  

If the practice is busy with Covid vaccinations the appointments system should say that there are no appointments available and then patients can decide whether to use other sources of health provison or whether they can wait for appointments to become available.  The current state just annoys patients.

title: Excellent
body:
Visited the hospital as my mum had cataract surgery.
Moorfield eye hospital is very functional and very well organised; the atmosphere is very friendly and warm. The staff is very polity and friendly; you can tell they do their work with dedication and a positive attitude. 
Excellent !

title: Not what it was
body: Absolutely Shocked by the attitude and line of questions asked from the doctor from my last consultation. Not happy at all about the service I’ve received not just this month stemming back to the beginning of my pregnancy.

title: Amazing team
body: We went to hospital on the 3rd of May in morning with my son who had a very low body temperature. Then we have been referred to the Children's emergency department. For the first time in my life everything was done so quick and professional. In around 2 hours we received our blood  test results and all the check ups were done and recommendations were given.  And even the blood test was done with no pain and fears for my son. All ladies working there are so amazing and were born to work with kids. Big Thank you to the whole team from Nikitos and his mum. All of you are amazing.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Poor service
body:
Having only recently registered with The Highlands Practice, I have found it extremely frustrating and disappointing.
To date medication for my husband has been refused with no explanation - a long chat with the pharmacist appeared to have sorted it.
I have requested an Econsult and am still waiting for the call from a GP.
Trying to ring the surgery takes an extremely long time.
I had reason to contact the surgery to arrange our 2nd Covid vaccination as we had not been called forward, only to be told we had to contact our previous surgery.
On contacting our previous surgery, the phone was answered promptly and we were able to arrange our 2nd jabs.
I do appreciate that we are in exceptional times, however the pandemic has been going on for over a year and we appear to be going backwards.

title: WORST DOCTORS SURGERY EVER
body:
Where should I begin. Everytime I call to make an appointment, I have to stay on hold for 40-60 mins. When the call is answered, I am told to leave a message for the doctor because there are no available appointments. I am then told that it isn't guaranteed that I will receive a face to face appointment with the doctor and I have to wait to receive a call from a different surgery and this is also not promised.
One day, I waited 40 mins on the call when I decided to visit the surgery instead. When I got there, I saw that the ladies at the reception were just having a chat and laughing. When I told them that I needed an appointment, they told me that I would have to contact them over the phone. I also made them aware that I did wait on the phone for over 40 mins however, they were very rude whilst dealing with the situation and rudely dismissed the fact that I was being very patient with them. They told me to go back home and call again as I couldn't make an appointment at the surgery. This just wasted another hour of my time. 
The point that I'm trying to make is that I am really angered at the service we receive when visiting the surgery. I am also looking elsewhere to register my family and myself as I am done with wasting any more time waiting for them to answer the phone.
I would definitely not recommend this surgery to anyone as I think that my experience was just one of the worst that people have had at this surgery.

title: Terrible receptionist, rude and aggressive
body: Every interaction I have with the receptionists makes me feel frustrated. Why is she a receptionist if she doesn't have any interest in helping people? She is rude and aggressive, please find someone else to do the job, she can't.

title: Poor Service
body: I have been trying for days to get an appointment today I started calling at 09.10 and throughout the day tried 168 times I gave up at 18.10 some 9 hours later, severe pain in my side but will have to live with it.  Awful service and a poor reflection on the work GP's do.

author: Miss Mac
title: Mental health care
body:
Have been struggling for years with my mental health, experienced trauma at a very early age.  
Have also experienced several traumas since as an adult.  
Was put on anti depressants in my mid 20s been on them for 20 plus years.  
Asked for a referral to my local mental health unit a few years back waited a few months and then seen a psychiatrist who I felt couldn't have been less interested if they tried. Diagnosed me with ptsd after 20 minutes told them I already had been given this diagnosis in my 30s, they changed my anti depressant and sent me on my way.  
Now ssri's alone have little affect on me, I told them I thought I had bi polar or bpd, and told them this a few times at different appointments but they didn't listen. I'm still on the same ssri and just been diagnosed with bpd, only got this diagnosis at my insistence that I be given a proper mental health evaluation. So now I'm told my medication isn't changing, which is nonsense as it's not working and ssri alone is not treating my symptoms.  
Really had enough of being fobbed off and ignored when u try to stick up for yourself u get made to feel like a difficult patient.  
It's 2021 and mental health care should be way better than this surely.

author: venusqx55
title: Panic and Anxiety
body:
With Lockdown 2 in place and the prospect of a 3rd I found myself getting increasingly anxious on a daily basis and this was at times leading to panic attacks. I couldn’t sleep dispute being so tired. My head and heart was racing, I felt sick, couldn’t catch my breath and was just so on edge all the time. I wasn’t however able to pinpoint what was bothering me.  
After talking to my doctor I was advised to self refer to Inclusion Thurrock. They come back to me really quickly and I was put on a 6 week panic management course. This really helped me understand that what was happening within my body was normal and I started to feel I was taking back control.  
After this course I went on to 8 weeks of 121 weekly sessions. These expanded on the work I had begun in the panic management course and delved deeper into my personal issues. The weekly homework allowed me to work on my issues outside of the sessions and slowly start to understand and control the panic and anxiety. Throughout the support from inclusion was second to none. They was all understanding and made me feel comfortable discussing the problems I was having.  
I now feel much better able to deal with my ever reducing problems and I know if I needed inclusion help in the future I wouldn’t hesitate.  
Many Thanks

author: CatrionaR
title: Covid Vaccination
body: Really well run, very friendly staff, couldn’t improve on the service

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Dumfries10
title: My stay in ward 10
body: From start to finish I just want to say the care was excellent! Thanks to the whole orthopaedic team, 10/10

author: bella110
title: Excellent care
body:
I am writing to thank Dr. Rane-Malcolm for all of her care over the last few years whilst I have attended for eye surgery and follow up appointments which are still ongoing.  
Dr. Rane-Malcolm gives expert care at all times when I meet her despite working within very busy clinics. I feel very safe in her hands and appreciate all of her care.  
When I attended for my last eye surgery at St. John's Hospital all of the team where fantastic and give excellent care.  
The outpatient teams at the Princess Alexandra Eye Pavilion are also fantastic.

author: BirthingMum
title: Induction of Labour
body:
The RCM itself has a guideline for induction recommending continuous birth partner support, women feeling in control and given opportunities to be involved in decision making and consent achieved, wherever possible provide aids, privacy, space to mobilise (none in a 4 bedded bay, could barely fit the ball in next to the bed), birthing balls, water immersion, peaceful settings to rest and sleep.  
At no point was I asked my preferences, I had to ask for things like birthing balls, monitoring on a ball instead of a bed,I had no privacy or space.  
I waited hours to be able to get in a bath because it was in use. My main birth partner couldnt stay thanks to there not being siderooms which I understand but why on earth would you put a birthing woman in a room full of post natal mums with crying babies?! That is not at all helpful or conducive to labouring.  
My first midwife in the delivery suite was wonderful and calming and respected my choices to avoid lying on the bed and worked with me. She explained everything.  
Then the nightshift started.  
I had a midwife give me an injection when I am pretty confident I said no - although some memories are foggy which is why I havent taken further action. I had the same midwife argue with me when I said I didnt want the injection to get the placenta out and had agreed a natural third stage with my medical team. I had a midwife make jokes about missing their dinner break because I gave birth, whilst I was lying in bed after a spinal, feeling very vulnerable. It made me feel awful.  
My golden hour I got as in baby left on my chest but no one left the room, lights were kept bright -I was having my tear checked out but still I had very little alone time before going to theatre.  
I had to be my own advocate every step of my stay and it was exhausting. I did not feel like people really tried to get informed consent and there was ageneral culture of, we know whats best for you so just do what we say.  
The theatre team were amazing on the other hand. My anesthetist in particular was incredible, he made me feel at ease and actually talked me through everything he was doing. And the whole room was nice and quiet and calm.  
Post labour the ward experience was OK, its still really hard to be left alone at night after 2 days in labour, I was exhausted and had a jaundiced baby who needed waking 3 hourly. The ward rounds could have done with giving advice written down it was hard to retain information when sleep deprived with a baby breastfeeding during the conversation.  
One other lovely person I met was the pelvic floor physio she was really clear and made me feel comfortable. She was really helpful and have written information too.  
I cant remember any names as it was 2019 and ive only just felt able to write one of these. I dont plan on giving birth in the RAH again if i can avoid it, overall it was a pretty negative experience for me.

title: Back to Pre-COVID appointment delays
body: The earliest appointment available is 16 days away. I can call back in 2 days at 8.00am when more appointments will become free, I have been there before, all that happens is I am told the appointments are all gone try again at 1.30. I have been submitted to hospital in the past for a minor ailment which turned serious due to this merry go round. Me and my partner are forced to pay thousands for a service not provided! I am forced to pay for a private doctor which the appointment is usually same day and is less than than 10% of what I am forced to pay the NHS

author: sunsx34
title: Parent admitted to female medical
body:
Parent admitted to female medical. Non verbal and can't communicate any needs. Unable to get an update from nursing staff.  
This virtual visit was our only means of communication with our mum. Whilst she couldn't talk to us she was able to smile and we could see her. This provided more content to us, as before we didnt know if mum was alive or dead.  
From booking to the visit, I can only express my extreme gratitude. The process was so simple, and Sylvia the booking agent so reassuring and helpful. This is a vital service and one I cannot recommend enough!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: My wonderful stay
body: After having been admitted informally for a bipolar blip I received the best of all possible care from the wonderful staff there. In recognition of their care and concern I drew portraits of them all which are now on display in the hospital office!

readBy.name: Tees, Esk and Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust

author: Anonymous-feedback
title: Maternity day assessment unit
body:
I am 10 and a half weeks’ pregnant and have suffered with hyperemesis gravidarum (HG) since 5 weeks’ pregnant.  
HG is at the most sever end of pregnancy sickness. It is NOT ‘morning sickness’. It is an extremely debilitating condition that holds you hostage for weeks and months. Vomiting excessively every day, 24/7 nausea and an inability to keep any food and fluids down. You lose all ability to do anything for yourself; bed bound for months on end. You lose weight and you’re likely to need acute hospital intervention throughout, especially during early pregnancy. You feel scared, isolated and extremely desperate.  
During the 5 and a half weeks of suffering with HG, I have needed emergency care on three occasions due to severe dehydration, severe constipation and an allergic reaction to medication. There is a huge lack of understanding of HG and how to treat it, both by medical professionals and by society more widely, meaning accessing the right care and support is often a real battle. A battle that is near impossible to fight while suffering HG as you’re so unwell and weak. It saddens me to say that the health care I have received so far has been very disappointing, both in the community and within hospital settings.  
That is until my partner spoke to a lovely midwife at Treliske’s maternity day assessment unit. Beth listened. Beth was compassionate. Beth was going to do everything she could to ensure I was properly assessed and given the care I desperately needed.  
I was invited to attend the day assessment unit the same day however I was so severely unwell I couldn’t manage leaving my bed let alone consider the 50 minute drive to Treliske.  
The next morning I found the last bit of strength I had left to get out of bed, throw some clothes on, and my partner managed to get me to the unit.  
Sick bowl in hand, I was greeted by wonderful midwife Olga. Olga cared deeply too. Olga was equally as compassionate as Beth had been on the phone the day before. Olga was going to help me.  
You cannot underestimate what this meant to me. I’ve spent weeks feeling like I was falling through the cracks. Not being heard. The severity of my illness not being taken as seriously as it should be. I cried when I spoke to both Beth and Olga because I knew they were listening to me.  
My experience of care at the unit from here continued to be wonderful.  
I was so severely dehydrated that my veins had collapsed meaning two midwives and a doctor were unable to insert a cannula into my arm to administer vital fluids I desperately needed. After numerous failed attempts and painful blown veins an anaesthetist was called but as it was the weekend it was taking a while. Thankfully, another doctor was called to try to assist, and she managed to access a vein in my right arm. Thank you Dr.  
I was given 2 bags of fluid over 4 hours, anti-sickness medication, as well as various other meds and vitamins to help rebuild my strength. Thank you Olga for administering the anti-sickness slowly and waiting with me to make sure I didn’t have a reaction. I have been taking this same medication for several weeks now but when it is administered straight into the vein there is a risk of a different / stronger reaction, so I was very grateful to Olga for her care.  
Thank you to the most wonderful doctor who led my care at the unit for your compassion throughout. Dr Askaroff, thank you for believing me when I told you I had eaten no more than 4 slices of toast in the same amount of days and had drank very little, all while vomiting in between. Thank you for paying attention to how weak I was, my dry-cracked lips, ghost-like pale complexion and insisting I receive fluids regardless of ketone and blood pressure readings. Despite being rushed off your feet caring for other ladies during a busy weekend, you continually visited me to see how I was and how I was responding to treatment. Thank you for taking the time to talk me through different medication options that are safe for both me and my baby and giving me the confidence to try different things that might help with my nausea and vomiting. I very much appreciated this as previous severe reactions to other anti-sickness medications has left me very nervous when trying anything new.  
I had arrived at the unit around 9am. After the fluids and medication, and managing to keep down a slice of wholemeal toast and a biscuit or two (this is a real improvement when you have HG), I had passed the stable enough to go home test. I left the unit by around 7.30pm feeling more hydrated.  
The staff at the unit have written a letter to my GP detailing the medications I should be prescribed. I am now able to access the unit for IV fluids and anti-sickness whenever I feel I am becoming dehydrated again, meaning I don’t need to go through the trauma of seeing a GP first or through the emergency department. When you have HG it is almost impossible to leave your bed let alone attend numerous appointments before getting access to vital fluids to rehydrate you. So this is such a huge relief and further testimony to the wonderful care I received. Why I wasn’t referred to this unit before now I do not know, however. It is very disappointing.  
To the lovely staff who cared for me at the unit; from the bottom of my heart, on behalf of myself, my partner and our baby, thank you so much for everything. I’ll never forget any of you during what has been and continues to be an extremely difficult time x

title: Endoscopy with sedation
body: The consultant and nurses were excellent very professional and made me feel at ease throughout a big thank-you ..

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent GP & Practice
body: I only have good words to write about this practice and the GP who has been dealing with for the last 6 months, the support and service has been outstanding. I can’t thank them enough.

title: Really sad to see the GP practice failing.
body:
Appointment system does not work. Unable to get appointment on day and pre book in weeks time. 2-3 Weeks to months to get one.
Surgery unable to organise repeat prescriptions service. Back and forth to fix missing items.
There are continuous problems with the receptionist extremely rude, unhelpfully.
have raised complaints to doctors, management and next door chemists
These problems are not new and span 2-3 years maybe longer, pre pandemic.
Same problems. Not taken on board. Not resolved. Not there problem.

title: Shocking
body:
My elderly mother attended today, nurse was not happy and asked GP to have a look at her legs. A GP arrived and made a diagnosis from at least a 10 foot distance, and then informed my mother who is in her 80 ‘s that she needs to have her legs raised higher than her chest. The GP informed my mum to take some pills that had been prescribed previously, which caused my mum more problems than she started with, then left the surgery.
Why are GP’ s unavailable? The nurses do an amazing job and they must be so frustrated with the seeming lack of GP’s and the lack of empathy when a GP makes a rare appearance, why could this GP examine my mum properly wearing PPE as nurses, carers etc wear.
I understand GP’s are assisting with COVID vaccinations and therefore cannot understand why this GP could not cover the distance and examine my mum closer and give her some care.

title: Amazing nurses
body:
The nurses in the endoscopy department were extremely friendly and just amazing at their job, they went above and beyond their job role.
During the procedure, they kept a nice conversation and even made me laugh, which made me feel so much more comfortable. 
They really deserve a pay rise for all the extra effort they put in.

readBy.name: North Middlesex University Hospital NHS Trust

title: Great practice
body: Come here Bank holiday Monday evening,was busy.But service was great,nice and helpful staff,all coordinated.Well done 👍

title: Impressive practice
body:
My partner was admitted to James Ward on the 27th April and discharged today 4th May. Every staff member, from ward orderly to the doctors were kind, professional and thorough.  The nursing staff were caring, cheerful. and attentive. Despite the last year the NHS staff have had to deal with to keep up the stamina and retain their humour and kindness required to run a cardiac ward is very impressive.
Well done the Conquest Hospital and James Ward,  thankyou.

title: Very poor patient care
body: I had a fall so thought of going to this practice because of severe back pain. I was unable to walk properly or sit down. After getting registered waited for 3 hours to see the doctor. The doctor didn’t do any proper pain assessment, or investigation. She was not interested to listen to my problem or pain, she was only looking at her phone and texting while the whole conversation. I was not even given painkillers or any proscription and was asked to buy medications over the counter. Then she told me to go to queens hospital if it still hurts. So my point is why did I waste my 3-4 hours there to see a doctor if they could only advise me to go to queens hospital. What is the point of the walk-in poly clinic???

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: rude and unhelpful admin staff
body: tried to phone for a  scrip today between 10-12.15, all I got was "busy" signal I tried  half a dozen times with the same result, I rang after lunch and was told "ring back tomorrow" I explained I had rang in the morning  answer "nothing I can do ring in the morning" I asked to speak to a doctor was told 18th May was the earliest ( today is 4th) asked to speak to practice manager answer " not here you will have to write a letter! can  I email " no, must be a letter". The scrip I wanted was for Anxiety the last thing I needed was a member of staff with as much caring as an angry wasp!

title: Worst practice I've ever had to deal with
body: Without doubt the worst and most dysfunctional practice I've ever had the misfortune of using. Cancelled appointments, messed up prescriptions, impossible booking procedure. In the 9 years of living here, I don't think they've ever got anything right.

title: Gone downhill in the last couple of years
body: Sorry to say that ever since the appearance of "patient navigators" in 2019 the practice has gone downhill rapidly. I am sure the doctors are doing their best but since lockdown the situation has become critical. I have no faith in being able to SEE a GP, even if the medical condition warrants it and trying to get someone to answer the phone is almost impossible.This makes us feel very vulnerable and unsure of getting help when it is needed. The last time I visited I did not see any occupied consulting rooms - the doors were open and no-one was in. The situation when you are texted a telephone appointment that will be made "in surgery hours" is not acceptable. Even British Gas can give you a 2 hour slot!

author: mumslife
title: Health visitor
body: My Health Visitor, Nicola, from Holywood Arches has been a great source of support to me for the last 2 years. I have two boys-   One with eating issues and one who had weight issues and a tongue tie. Nicola has been not only lovely but also extremely supportive to me. She listened to all my concerns and took me seriously and went out of her way to provide advice. When she didn’t have answers she referred me on. For example, I had problems breastfeeding my second child because of his tongue tie and Nicola immediately referred me to a Lactation Consultant. She is always at the end of the phone if I have any worries and I can honestly say she’s made a huge (positive) difference to my experience as a mother. My third child is now on that way and I’m so grateful that I’ll have Nicola to rely on for information and support. Having a good Health Visitor can make a profound difference when dealing with worries and problems when bringing up children.   Thanks Nicola!

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Letting down elderly patients
body: The practice has adopted procedures which do not take into consideration the needs of elderly patients or those who do not use the internet.  The recommended procedure is to go online.  If you can’t do this you have to wait 20 minutes for a receptionist to answer the phone, who then tells you to go online.  Everything appears to have been done to make life easier for those working at the practice with no regard for the needs of patients.  They need an efficient, promptly answered, polite phone service for those unable or unwilling to go online.  Written on behalf of my elderly relative who cannot access the online service.

title: Very well done to all.
body:
Today I had my second Covid jab and just the same as my first one, it was a no fuss, efficient and a friendly experience. Great job to all at the practice, for this and how you all operate in in all aspects of the surgery. Well done:)
Thank you.

title: No Communication
body:
Tried for 1 hour to contact someone and it just keeps cutring you off Waste of time.
Surely someone should be able to answer a phone.  Glad i have a decent hospital where i live Feel sorry for the people inand around Boston.

author: Pennylane
title: My sons tongue tie
body: On the birth of my second baby my baby boy. I asked the staff present if he had a tongue tie. (my other child also has one). I was told he did not. However I wasn't convinced as I was sure I could see one. After having issues with feeding and working hard on our latch I then asked my health visitor if she thought he had a tongue tie and she agreed with me that he did. She then put a referral in and I heard nothing. By this point my son was 5 weeks old he had dropped percentiles and it was causing me pain and oversupply and engorgment. I was then told I had to speak to a GP to get a referral which I have and have still heard nothing about getting this divided. My son is now approaching 10 weeks old and find this very frustrating. I fed my other child exclusively breast milk until 18 months old I am experienced in both breastfeeding and tongue ties and know my son. All I want it for someone to look at is and make the decision to divide it.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: orangewz64
title: Vaccine
body: Went for a 2nd vaccine today everything 100%

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: defenderzx84
title: Virtual Service
body: Mum suffers dementia & was taken to hospital without anyone from her family allowed to accompany her despite of requiring 24/7 one to one care which has been provided over the past few years at home. With hospital staff only having limited time to communicate daily, the virtual FaceTime has been the main point of contact For the family to see how mum is doing & look in on her.. It has been really reassuring for the family to be able to see her & the staff involved have been excellent at trying to communicate to mum that we are talking to her as see doesn’t understand the technology. An excellent service which we as a family really appreciate. Thank you

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: girafferr85
title: colonoscopy
body:
Hello, my recent visit for a colonoscopy examination went fantastically well.  
Friendly staff, all procedures explained, treated like a friend, felt very safe.  
Won't rush to do it again but would not worry about another visit.

title: Staff don’t listen
body: Took my dad here recently and was appalled by the lack of interest shown by staff. They do not listen to relatives advice regarding the patient and as a consequence didn’t carry out tests I later deemed to be crucial. Some doctors not wearing masks and no regard for distancing. I will never take my family here again. Not a good look when doctors are playing on mobile phones instead of working.

title: rude receptionists
body: Receptionists make you wait an hour before answering the call. Been numerous times where they answer and shut the phone on your face. I get the energy that most receptionists don’t even want to be there and take their negativeness out on patients. Receptionists never try to resolve the issue and tend to say they sent something to your email when they never did. They also say they will call back but that is never ever the case. The waiting area is not very social distanced either so more restrictions needed. Only good thing about this place is the doctors so nice and friendly but however the receptionists let this place down

title: Wonderful care
body: I've had nothing but good experiences so far since I registered here at the end of last year.  My doctor is really caring and thorough, and the reception staff are friendly and intelligent. One really couldn't guess the problems caused by Covid and the stress they must all be under.

author: Anniejohn
title: Elderly father in hospital
body: Dominik set my father up on the video call. Dominik is exceptional so kind and understanding. Tara who booked the calls was amazing too. Virtual call for Craigavon hospital is exceptional and a lifesaver to families. Excellent service. Thank you

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Outstanding Hodpital
body: My Dad is currently In CTICU. I cannot commend this unit highly enough. The staff are amazing, all of them. We were there all night last night and despite the nursing staff and the healthcare assistant being extremely busy, they kept us informed all through the night and the lovely Healthcare provided refreshments etc all night. Nothing was too much trouble. The staff were extremely vigilant regarding PPE and the unit was spotless and calm despite being busy. At one point my dad had 4 people working on him at once calmly but efficiently. You are all angels and no matter what the outcome ends up as he could not be in a better place.

title: Appalling
body:
I registered with this practice a week ago having moved from london. I am 37 and tech savvy. I’ve been unwell for over a week and have chronic asthma so, as always instructed by my previous gp, I attempted to book an appointment due to my peak flow reducing. I tried calling all day but kept being cut off. I tried to book online but this in disabled without an explanation. I resorted to using a social media app for help on how to make an appointment a d a fellow patient instructed me to use econsult. Which I did - I got a quick response telling me I have a viral infection and take paracetamol.... yes, I know that.  I wanted advice on how to manage my asthma with reduced peak flow but with no way of speaking to a human being it’s impossible. I cannot manage a chronic condition in this way so I’ve registered with another surgery. Covid-19 pandemic cannot be blamed as my previous surgery in London maintained an excellent service where I could always have a say same telephone consultation with a gp as they appreciate asthma can deteriorate quickly.
I am a nurse and I am ashamed of this surgery. Absolutely poor quality.

title: Unhelpful reception staff
body: The receptionist was incredibly rude when I came to drop off a form with a suggested prescription from a specialist at one of our local  hospitals. Every time I have anything to do with this GP surgery, the reception staff are incredibly rude

title: Shocking triage service
body: You now cannot book an appointment but have to use their online triage system of inputting your symptoms and waiting for someone to get back to you. My husband was very unwell, you still have to go through the system and wait for a call back which can take 3-5 days. Despite marking it as requiring on the day treatment and calling the practice twice to escalate that he needed some treatment that day no one called back. He ended up going to the walk in centre and receiving antibiotics there. Cannot fault the Dr's and Nurses once you finally ever do manage to speak to them but the triage system has serious faults in and requires reviewing.

title: Great Docters, shame about the staff
body: Had a message to call the surgery regards to ongoing issue, rang only to be told that somebody is trying find & will contact me by phone. Going in to second week but still no joy.

title: Excellent practice
body: I can’t praise this practice enough. Extremely polite, friendly, organised and professional staff who put the patient first and take the time to listen and go out of their way to ensure they can help. First class receptionists and practice nurse.

title: Very pleased with care and attention
body: During the past year we have used e-consult for admin and medical concerns. On all occasions the reception/admin staff have been very helpful and we have been able to access medical advice and support where appropriate. We have found all GPS to be helpful and understanding. Thank you very much everyone.

title: Covid-19 vaccination
body: I attended this practice for my first vaccination in March 2021 and was very impressed with how well organised the whole process was. Very little waiting time and everyone was pleasant, friendly and efficient. Thank you so much to all the staff and volunteers - your hard work is very much appreciated.

title: Appointments
body: Do not have to wait to long to speak to a GP, appointment is always offered and everyone is very friendly.

title: Well organised and friendly
body: A word of thanks from me to all staff at Robertson House who, from the very first attendant through to nurses and helpers, were all very professional and friendly as well. Not easy to achieve with the many thousands of people passing through - I was pleased to be one of the many.

title: Great practice
body: Great staff felt comfy all appointment the lady who gave ne the scan was lovely made me feel confident and comfortable

title: Doctor made me feel much worse
body: I was treated as though I was wasting the doctor's  time when I was so poorly with sinusitis I could hardly breathe. She was abrupt and condescending - I have noticed similar reviews of this doctor who has the worst "bedside manner" I have ever come across!! I knew I had bad sinusitis (experienced the same a couple of times in my life) after over a week of headaches, coughing up green mucus, breathlessness and exhaustion - and I knew that antibiotics would work.  I am generally well so stage three cancer seven years ago was a shock ... but I got over it.  I am a doctor's daughter and very aware of how precious a doctor's time is (also one of 6 children) so I see the doctor as little as possible - maybe twice a year.  Anyway, the doctor told me I had a virus and it would go away in a few days.  I was not happy but I endured a few more days of misery then dragged myself back to the surgery.  The same doctor was obviously not pleased to see me again and she was not happy that I wanted antibiotics - she treated me like I was an irritating nuisance ... but I was really ill and hardly able to talk.  My family were also concerned as they could see that I was really struggling and I rarely complain about my health.  Finally, the doctor agreed to write a prescription for antibiotics and advised me to wait a few days to see if the "virus" resolved.  I took them immediately and started to improve within 24 hours.  I was completely well once I completed the course.  I should not have to beg, I should not feel worse after seeing my doctor rather than better!!

title: Even this survey fails.......
body: Not only does the surgery fail to book telephone appointments without 3 or 4 attempts over several days, all the while costing £3+ each time to listen to Covid messages and bland muzak but even this survey fails because it assumes that one has actually managed to VISIT the place even though it appears to be harder than getting into a nuclear bunker! The Practice should publish the days and times that ALL the eight GP's are actually available as it appears some are only working 2 or 3 days a week, if that. What is so difficult about booking a phone consultation? Receptionist answers phone, looks at the on-screen diary and books the next available slot - simple! Instead there is: no answer; cut-off; answer and told to call back on another day. Try the 'Econsult' in desperation and guess what - it informs one to contact the surgery! End result of GP's in general kicking the can down the road is that already overstretched & over worked A & E departments get unnecessary visits putting further pressure on them. GP's shouldn't continue hiding in their Covid fallout shelters, virtually every other sector is back to normal or near normal and some of us have been on the front line throughout the pandemic despite the associated risks. Absolutely frustrating and no logical reason for it.

title: Nothing has changed , poor service and unhelpful
body:
I was promised a call back which I never received. 
Three months waiting for a referral despite promises.
I may have used E-consult, the medical centre's new bureaucratic attempt to draw a wedge between patient and doctor, to get help and out of 7 requests, I have  received  feedback only once.
A terrible service with unhelpful staff and receptionists.

title: Friendly staff put you at ease
body: Doc and nurses were very friendly before, during and after my procedure.  The hospital was quiet at the time of my visit so felt very cared for. The nurse ensured I made the doc aware of my covid injection, just in case it was an issue for my op.

title: Great staff
body: I was admitted in the early hours of 1st May to AMU, it was unexpected and I felt anxious having not been in hospital since giving birth 40 yrs ago! However all the staff I came in contact with were wonderful, efficient, friendly, professional and reassuring. Its not somewhere you want to be, but the staff made it a positive experience for me. I was only there a day but could see the challenges they must face on a daily basis, they do it with a cheerful attitude and a smile for all. The 2 nurses on AMU 1st May were working a 12 hour shift and were wonderful from 8am to 8pm! Many thanks to everyone!

readBy.name: Tameside and Glossop Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: Friendly, efficient & caring support from all the team who have gone the extra mile to make procedures relating to the Covid-19 pandemic run as smoothly as possible ☺️

title: Well organised vaccine centre
body: Helpful and friendly, very well organised. Couldn’t fault it. Well done to all the volunteers. Easy car parking, all well signposted.
